intro: Gyrosphragma latipetala, commonly known as the broad-petaled gyrosphragma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
